text:
The Araliya hotel was a great experience, the staff are very friendly and attentive. We arrived at 2pm for check however was very busy with people still checking out and our room was not ready however Mithurshan sorted us out with temp room so we could freshen up from our travels. Later he contacted us to say our room was ready and he changed us to our room, the room was spacious and the view of the sea was beautiful and as described. 
The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful at the beach They helped you set up a sun lounger with a towel and asked if you needed anything to let them know. 
For breakfast there were few members of staff Nanayakkara, Hansani, Hakeem, Sathira who were very friendly and always welcoming every morning with a smile. Breakfast was buffet and food was good. The fresh omelette was nice and the fresh juice and fruit was epic. In the evening the lounge area the gentleman name I think is Shelat was exceptional, he was friendly and attentive, my wife wanted peppermint tea which they didn't have but he said they could do fresh mint in hot water. Excellent service and no hassle. He excided  our expectations and my our staff perfect.
Nilam ( I think his name is) he was our servers on the beach for evening dinner where we had fresh amazing king tiger prawns cooked in Garlic butter. He provided us with amazing service and made our evening special. Thank you to the whole team at the hotel.
title: Amazing hotel, friendly staff

text:
Lovely little hotel. The stars here were the attentive, friendly and accommodating staff. They were lovely! The food was quite nice too, but sometimes the portions were a bit too big and food went to waste. Since the hotel is small, there arent anh buffets, but a la carte meals and set menus. 

The pool was clean, and our 4 year old son had a lovely time in it. The whole hotel needs a mild refurbish, with replacing bits in the bathrooms and dining areas. The only con is the lack of beach area. Perhaps because the hotel is located in a bay, the tiny strip of sand was dirty and not child friendly. However, the sandy area near the sun beds made up for this. Overall, a lovely, relaxed stay. I would recommend this hotel more to solo, couple, and adult travellers, although small families will enjoy a few days too! Make sure to look out for Spicy and Chai- the hotels resident dogs, if you are a dog lover.
title: Lovely family trip, although the beach wasn't the best

This was our 6th hotel in our stay in Sri Lanka and by far the best.
We were upgraded to a suite which was amazing with a fantastic view of the clean and private beach. 
The food was great. We were delighted to have a set menu served to us as we were so sick of buffets!
Every single staff member was attentive and friendly with very good English. Nothing was too much trouble. The staff made this hotel. We have stayed in hotels where facilities were great but the staff weren’t friendly or attentive. This really matters. 
The only criticism I would have are the sun lounges on the beach. They need to be adjustable backs for people to sit and read. And umbrellas would be good too as by the afternoon everyone was crowded under the tree for shade and not spread out along the beach.
title: Amazing and friendly staff

text:
Very nice medium range hotel by the beach.

The rooms were soo gorgeous with their lighting, colors and the design. Spacious and with a balcony. Running hot water and shower.

Best thing is the access to the beautiful, beautiful beach with light turquoise blue water. Restaurant is right on the beach, which makes you forget about time watching the sea.

They had good sea food options for dinner and nice SriLankan breakfast (English breakfast also available). Indranil (Indu) who attended us at the restaurant was very polite and helpful. It was fun interacting with him. They also have a cafe and bakery for snacks.

The beach might tempt you to have a dip, but be very cautious, as it is deep and not ideal for a swim. If you are traveling by own car, parking might be a problem as there is limited space at the hotel.

Overall a wonderful stay and would definitely recomment.
title: Beautiful hotel with beautiful beach view

text:
We stayed here for 10 nights and had a great experience. What a lovely little Hotel, with excellent staff, a special mention to Kevin and  also Beauntie (sorry if spelt wrong )they saw to all our needs Kevin is a gem .
All the staff were great, always smiling and happy to say hello when they met you daily.
The guy that seen to the beach beds was great. also he always managed to find you a great spot on the beach. 
Not forgetting the guy that seen to my pre-bed cocktails each night.
We had a superior room looking out towards the beach on the ground floor. It was lovely .
Any small Repairs that had to be seen to there was no wait  involved. After reporting the issues to reception , the lady on reception was very helpful and accommodating.
We particularly enjoyed barbecue night which was on a Friday. The food was amazing. Breakfast was also good too You would never leave hungry. The seafood was lovely also.
You could use the pool at the other hotel just ask reception and they will send a buggy for you. It will take you there and back free.
The only downsides I would mention is the taxi that took us to the airport the  driver was falling asleep and had to stop to get a wash and a coffee  we had still an hour and a half to go he just left us sitting in the car but this was not the hotels fault, it was scary as he was texting and eating and was all over the road when he continued, not the fault of the hotel .
Also, the loud music from the hotels on each side of ours was horrendous so loud. This was out of our hotels control. Unfortunately one morning it went on till 4.30am  the morning mostly 2 am at the earliest once again, not our hotels fault .
The only other problem we had was the security guard nightwatchman asked us for money on several occasions, we tipped most of the staff but never gave him anything as it’s not good to ask.
Sri Lanka is a lovely place and the Hotel we stayed in was amazing in every way , it’s just a shame that the area has been taken over by a lot of tourists from one county in particular 80-90% which is such a shame hardly anyone from the UK .
title: Fabulous little friendly hotel .
